intro: Microlicia harleyi, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15–30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light. Its foliage is thick and velvety, often with a striking coloration that enhances its ornamental value. Microlicia harleyi is popular as a houseplant due to its ability to thrive in controlled indoor environments.
